page.title: 06LEGENDS
page.content: Sheppey's most famous legend is based on the story of Robert de Shurland whose statue is in Minster Abbey. Robert de Shurland, riding on the beach one day,met an old woman who foretold that de Shurland would be killed by his own horse.De Shurland promptly killed the horse,after which he forgot the matter.Many years later, whilst on a walk,he absent mindedly kicked a bone lying on the ground.The bone,which was in fact that of his old horse,stuck in his foot which went septic causing his death. Another story is about an ancient pagan spirit whose image is carved above a door inside the Abbey. This spirit,The Green Man,is half man and half tree,and if any unwary traveller should sit beneath a tree that is actually The Green Man,he is never seen again. Laurence Hayes.
